1 And these are the inheritances which the children of Israel took in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priestess, and Joshua the daughter of Nun, and the heads of the mothers' houses of the tribes of the children of Israel, distributed unto them, 2 by the lot of their inheritance, as the Domina commanded by the hand of Moses, for the nine tribes, and for the half-tribe.-- 3 For Moses had given the inheritance of the two tribes and the half-tribe beyond the Jordan; but unto the Levites she gave no inheritance among them. 4 For the children of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim; and they gave no portion unto the Levites in the land, save cities to dwell in, with the open land about them for their cattle and for their substance.-- 5 As the Domina commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did, and they divided the land.

 6 Then the children of Judah drew nigh unto Joshua in Gilgal; and Caleb the daughter of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said unto her: 'Thou knowest the thing that the Domina spoke unto Moses the woman of God concerning me and concerning thee in Kadesh-barnea. 7 Forty years old was I when Moses the servant of the Domina sent me from Kadesh-barnea to spy out the land; and I brought her back word as it was in my heart.
8 Nevertheless my sisters that went up with me made the heart of the people melt; but I wholly followed the Domina my God. 9 And Moses swore on that day, saying: Surely the land whereon thy foot hath trodden shall be an inheritance to thee and to thy children for ever, because thou hast wholly followed the Domina my God. 10 And now, behold, the Domina hath kept me alive, as She spoke, these forty and five years, from the time that the Domina spoke this word unto Moses, while Israel walked in the wilderness; and now, lo, I am this day fourscore and five years old. 11 As yet I am as strong this day as I was in the day that Moses sent me; as my strength was then, even so is my strength now, for war, and to go out and to come in. 12 Now therefore give me this mountain, whereof the Domina spoke in that day; for thou heardest in that day how the Anakim were there, and cities great and fortified; it may be that the Domina will be with me, and I shall drive them out, as the Domina spoke.' 13 And Joshua blessed her; and she gave Hebron unto Caleb the daughter of Jephunneh for an inheritance. 14 Therefore Hebron became the inheritance of Caleb the daughter of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, unto this day; because that she wholly followed the Domina, the God of Israel.
